newsitem.title: USA: Freddie Mac sets $1.2 bln in REMICs.
newsitem.headline: Freddie Mac sets $1.2 bln in REMICs.

text.p: The Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac or FHLMC) said it issued $1.2 billion of real estate mortgage investment conduit (REMIC) securities.

REMIC series 1921, underwritten by Lehman Bros Holdings Inc, is backed by $150 million of 30-year single-family fixed rate mortgages, FHLMC said. The issue priced on December 12, has a settlement date of January 30 and pays a coupon 6.5 percent, the agency said.

REMIC series 1922, also underwritten by Lehman, totals $250 million and is backed by callable pass-through C030, Freddie Mac said. The issue priced on December 12, has a settlement date of January 30 and pays a coupon of 7.5 percent, FHLMC said.
Callable pass-through C030 is made up of $500 million of 30-year single-family fixed rate mortgages, the agency said.

REMIC series 1924, underwritten by Donaldson Lufkin & Jenrette, totals $250 million and is backed by strip 180, Freddie Mac said. The issue priced on December 13, has a settlement date of January 30 and pays a coupon of 7.5 percent, FHLMC said.

REMIC series 1923, underwritten by Goldman Sachs, is backed by $550 million of 30-year single-family fixed rate mortgages, Freddie Mac said. The issue priced on December 13, has a settlement date of December 30 and pays a coupon of 7.5 percent, the agency said.
